channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Remembering war correspondent Rod Nordland
item.description: After surviving many close calls as a war correspondent, Norland was diagnosed with a lethal brain tumor in 2019. He died June 22. In this 2024 interv...

item.title: The Supreme Court gives Trump a wave of victories in a blockbuster final week
item.description: The Supreme Court term has given the Trump administration a series of major wins in the final blockbuster week of its term. We rounded up the final de...

item.title: Supreme Court sides with Texas' age verification law for porn sites
item.description: The ruling is the first time that the court has imposed requirements on adult consumers in order to protect minors from having access to sexually expl...

item.title: Supreme Court postpones Louisiana redistricting case to next term
item.description: At issue is the Louisiana legislature's creation of a Black-majority congressional district, which a group of voters claimed was an illegal racial ger...

item.title: Supreme Court upholds program providing internet access to rural Americans
item.description: Conservative groups challenged the program, contending that Congress exceeded its powers in enacting legislation that delegated to the FCC the task of...

item.title: DHS secretary praises Florida’s ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ plan as agency expands immigration detention
May 23: CBS News 24/7, 1pm ET
item.description: President Trump threatens to hit Apple with a 25% tariff on iPhones made outside the U.S.; Astronaut Suni Williams delivers commencement speech at Mer...

item.title: Tehran is coming back to life, but its residents are deeply shaken
item.description: As Iran's capital resumes its old rhythms, the BBC's Lyse Doucet meets locals who wonder if peace will last.

item.title: U.S. to revoke immigration status of Haitian migrants in September
item.description: The Trump administration will revoke the legal status and work permits of hundreds of thousands of Haitian migrants in early September.

item.title: Trump praises Supreme Court ruling on nationwide injunctions
item.description: The Supreme Court, ruling in the birthright citizenship case, reined in federal judges' ability to issue nationwide injunctions.

item.title: Pardon applications are being carefully crafted with one man in mind: Donald Trump
item.description: President Donald Trump’s unconventional approach to clemency has spread hope among federal prisoners and formerly incarcerated people around the Unite...

item.title: Iranian foreign minister admits serious damage to nuclear sites
item.description: Abbas Araghchi also says there are no plans to resume nuclear talks with the US.

item.title: A month into Gaza's new aid system - killings, gunfire and chaos are routine
item.description: A month into the resumption of aid distribution in Gaza there have been repeated reports of killings, with a BBC Verify analysis of dozens of videos s...

item.title: Satirical Bezos mannequins pop up in Venice ahead of wedding
item.description: Unflattering installations depicting Amazon founder and his bride-to-be are attracting attention in the Italian city.

item.title: The Trump tariffs aren't causing U.S. prices to spike. Here's why.
item.description: Economists warned that a barrage of new U.S. tariffs could trigger a renewed bout of inflation. So why aren't prices surging?

item.title: DR Congo and Rwanda sign long-awaited peace deal in Washington
item.description: The deal has been hailed by President Trump as "a great day" but there are potential pitfalls.

item.title: Sean "Diddy" Combs' lawyer calls music mogul's prosecution a "fake trial"
item.description: The prosecution in Sean "Diddy" Combs' trial made their closing arguments Thursday, after calling on 34 witnesses over the course of seven weeks.

item.title: Justice Department says Kilmar Abrego Garcia will face US trial before any move to deport him again
